speaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special
text: Thomas J. Huth, Andre Caporaso, Robert Douglass, Dana Mark McClure  * * *  ## The End Of An Era...  _    "I want the chair I was sitting in when I watched Neil Armstrong take his first step on the Moon.  And when the US hockey team beat the Russians in the '80 Olympics.  I want the chair I was sitting in the night you called me to tell me I had a grandson.  I want the chair I was in all those nights, when your mother used to wake me up with a kiss after I'd fallen asleep in front of the television.  You know, I still fall asleep in it.  And every once in a while, when I wake up, I still expect your mother to be there, ready to lead me off to bed... Oh, never mind.  It's only a chair."_ - Martin, after Frasier tries to replace his Barcalounger   * * *  ## Transcript {Mike Lee}    _ACT ONE  Scene One - Apartment It is morning, and Niles is playing the piano softly as Martin sits down to breakfast.  Outside, it is pouring rain.  Daphne brings a fry-up platter from the kitchen._

speaker: Daphne
text: I love it when he plays the piano.  No matter how gloomy it is outside, it makes everything seem a little brighter.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special

speaker: Martin
text: I feel the same way about bacon. [_serves himself_]

speaker: Daphne
text: He's so lucky to be musical. [_to Niles, who has stopped_] I'd give my right hand to be able to play the piano the way you do.

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm, sounds a bit like O. Henry meets Steven King... [_kisses her_] but still, if you're serious, I'd be willing to give you lessons.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'd love that!  I've wanted to play ever since I was little, and my family would sing rugby songs after my brothers' matches.  I can still see them, all muddied and bloodied, belting out songs like "The Old She-Crab" and "I Like A Moose."  Once, one of Michael's teeth fell out right in the middle of "Four Old Whores"!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.  How was your date last night?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm having breakfast with you.  You do the math.

speaker: Niles
text: Coffee?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please.  Thank you, Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, here's something that will cheer you up: eight years ago today, I moved in with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Eight years?  Are you sure?

speaker: Niles
text: Tbis is quite an anniversary.  You weren't even with Lilith for eight years.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, Niles, I hardly think it's the same thing.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not that different.  If you were a woman, you'd be his common-law wife by now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well now, I don't think that's-

speaker: Daphne
text: And think about this: if that date of yours had been the perfect woman, you'd still have to be with her nine years before you overtook him!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and actually if you add the eighteen years he spent at home prior to college; well, they've been together twenty- six years.

speaker: Martin
text: So we just missed our silver anniversary?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right...

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but good news: your 30th is Pearl! [_chuckles_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I think it's a remarkable accomplishment.  Happy anniversary, Dr. and Mr. Crane! _They all raise their coffee cups - all except Frasier, who looks anything but cheered up._

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, hear hear...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_as they clink their cups together and grin at him; sarcastic_] Ha, ha! _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Cafe Nervosa Frasier and Roz are sat at a table together._

speaker: Roz
text: I'm so sorry it didn't work out with Lucy last night, but don't worry.  I have tons of other friends better than her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thanks for starting at the bottom and working your way up.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey Roz, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Roz
text: What, are you taking piano lessons?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, Niles is gonna teach me.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm so jealous!  I've always wanted to learn to play.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, why don't you sit in with us?

speaker: Roz
text: Really?  Well, do you think Niles would mind?

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course not - and even if he does, he's so polite you'll never know.

speaker: Waiter
text: Hi, I'd like to tell you about our new frozen coffee drink, the "Caffalanche."  It comes in three flavors: "FrostyCoffee," "So Cocoa Cold"... [_checks his pad_] and "Chilla In Vanilla"!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll try the "So Cocoa Cold."

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, black coffee, thanks. [_the waiter leaves_] I hate what's happened to coffee.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm just saying I'm a regular joe and-

speaker: Frasier/Martin
text: ...I like my joe regular.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, I know.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what's wrong with liking plain old coffee, the way God made it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing!  What is wrong is subjecting me to the same shop- worn bellyaching every time you come in here.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, excuse me for having an opinion you don't agree with, I thought this was America. [_looks around_] Oh look, it is. [_gets up_] I'm going to get my coffee to go.

speaker: Daphne
text: That was a bit harsh, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: It has been eight years of the same complaints about the same things in the same places.  Honestly, sometimes I think he does it just to antagonize me.

speaker: Roz
text: [_to Daphne, laughing_] They're just like an old married couple! It's cute, isn't it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah...

speaker: Martin
text: [_as he leaves_] Well, I got my black coffee - of course, it was more expensive than a whole meal used to be.  Time was, you could get two eggs, potatoes, choice of breakfast meats-

speaker: Frasier
text: And still get change back from the nickel!  Will you just take your coffee?

speaker: Martin
text: [_to the girls_] See how he talks to me?  And on our anniversary, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh! _Martin leaves.  FADE OUT_ **THE RECLINE AND FALL OF WESTERN CIVILIZATION** _Scene Three - Apartment Niles is seated between Roz and Daphne on the piano bench.  All three have their hands poised above the keyboard without touching it._

speaker: Niles
text: Now, I want you to position your hands over the keyboard, fingers relaxed... [_they wiggle their fingers_] elbows loose... [_they wiggle their elbows_] Good.  O.K., shoulders low... [_they droop their shoulders_] Good, good, how are we doing?

speaker: Daphne
text: Fine.

speaker: Niles
text: Excellent.

speaker: Roz
text: O.K., I guess.

speaker: Niles
text: Good, good.

speaker: Roz
text: So when do we get to press down on the keys? [_accidentally presses one_]

speaker: Niles
text: Whoa, whoa!  We have a lot to learn first.  It could be weeks before we press down on the keys.

speaker: Daphne
text: I want to play a song!

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, isn't that why we're here?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, all in due time.  Here, wait, just watch my hands while I play a scale.  Watch this...

speaker: Frasier
text: Pardon me, Niles, but there was a television program I planned on watching.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, of course.  Uh, we'll continue the lesson in Daphne's room.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, how can we learn without a piano?

speaker: Niles
text: With these workbooks, and a box of adhesive stars! _Daphne and Roz share a look of exasperation as they follow Niles into the hallway.  Frasier turns on the TV and sits on the couch, with Eddie sitting next to him.  As he gets comfortable, Martin comes out with a bag of pretzels and a beer._

speaker: Martin
text: [_shudders_] That guy sure looks cold.  What are we watching?

speaker: Frasier
text: _I'm_ watching "Lost on the Mountain."

speaker: Martin
text: Ah.

speaker: Martin
text: Is that the mountain?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coldly_] Yes.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, they sure don't look lost.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the search party.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh. [_beat_] So who's lost?

speaker: Frasier
text: Apparently you are.  If you don't stop interrupting, I will be too. _Martin takes the hint and reaches for the bag of pretzels.  It makes a loud crinkle as he grasps it, and another as he tries to open it, unsuccessfully.  Catching Frasier's annoyed look, he tries to do it quietly.  To the other side of Frasier, Eddie sits up expectantly. After much rattling and crinkling, Martin opens the bag and takes a bite of one, making a loud crunch.  The noise has all but drowned out the TV._

speaker: Martin
text: [_mouth full_] Pretzel? _Frasier doesn't even respond.  Martin tosses the bag on the table again, and then reclines backward.  The Chair squeaks loudly._

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you mind?

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry! _He reaches for the bag again, but it is out of reach.  Mindful of the noise level, he inches the Chair forward little by little, making a squeak every time, and a thump when the footrest hits the bottom.  He reaches the bag, making another loud crinkle.  He pauses, worried. Frasier eyes him balefully.  Then Martin reclines backward again, making another loud squeak._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, honestly, Dad!  Is there nothing you can do that doesn't create some sort of cacophony?!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I didn't do it on purpose, I was trying to be considerate!

speaker: Frasier
text: If you were considerate, you would have oiled that chair when it began squeaking five years ago!

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, I don't know what's gotten into you, but you've been a real jerk lately.  Maybe you should watch TV somewhere else.

speaker: Frasier
text: I should go elsewhere?  I?  Just what do you suggest, that I find a documentary barn and watch it on their big screen? [_gets up_] You know what, I am- I'm just going to go take a walk, all right, and leave you with the television. [_grabs a coat from the rack_] You enjoy yourself.  Good day! _He grabs his keys and exits, slamming the door.  A second later he comes back in._

speaker: Frasier
text: I wish you would stop hanging your coat on my peg! _As he hangs up Martin's coat and grabs his own, we DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Four - Later The Armchair is lying on its back.  Martin is kneeling on the floor, applying oil to the hinges.  Niles comes in._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: [_from behind the Chair_] Down here.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sees the Chair, alarmed_] Oh my God, Dad! [_runs over and sees him_] Oh, I thought you'd capsized.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I was oiling my chair.  The squeaking was bugging Frasier.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh. [_gasps_] The carpet is a whole shade lighter under there. Ooh, except for those little black dots you just made.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, shoot!  I better get a towel. [_gets up_]

speaker: Niles
text: No, I'll get it.

speaker: Martin
text: No, it's all right, I'll get it- _He takes a step toward the kitchen and accidentally steps on the oil bottle, squirting a huge black streak onto the carpet.  They both gasp._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Niles
text: I'll get something to pick up the grease and clean it up! _Even as Niles runs into the kitchen, Frasier comes back from his walk - and gapes at the stain._

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell's happened?

speaker: Martin
text: Now, don't get upset.  I was oiling my chair, trying to get rid of the squeak, and I had a little spill.

speaker: Frasier
text: A little spill?  I just this carpet cleaned!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm sorry, it was an accident.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure, Dad!  "It was an accident."

speaker: Niles
text: [_applying paper towels_] It was an accident, I saw him step on it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you know as well as I do there are no accidents! Just admit it, Dad: your latent hostility toward me has been building through the years, little by little, until you've finally struck the Achilles Heel of my decor, the Berber carpet!

speaker: Martin
text: I did not do this on purpose!

speaker: Frasier
text: No?  I suggest you dig deep into the twisted caves of your subconscious, where malicious acts abide, clothed in the robes of plausible excuses!

speaker: Martin
text: For the last time, this was not malicious, it was an accident!

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't think you know the difference!

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, I do!  That was an accident! [_squirts oil all over Frasier's shirt and face_] THIS is malicious! _Martin storms out of the living room, while Frasier just stands there, quivering with outrage.  Niles double-checks the label of the cleaning fluid he's holding and gives it an extra-vigorous shake.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - Later Workmen carry swatches of the old carpet out.  Niles and Frasier are sat on the hardwood steps at the back of the room.  All the furniture from the carpeted areas has been piled onto the balcony outside._

speaker: Niles
text: What color is the new carpet?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm going up a shade... to "Harvest Wheat."

speaker: Niles
text: I thought the next shade up was "Buff."

speaker: Frasier
text: It used to be, but they've discovered a whole new color in between.

speaker: Niles
text: So now it's "Tofu, Putty, Oatmeal"...

speaker: Both
text: "Almond, Harvest Wheat"...

speaker: Frasier
text: "and Buff."

speaker: Niles
text: That's going to be hard to get used to. [_Frasier nods_] Where's Daphne? [_checks his watch_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, she's out taking a walk with Dad.  An extra-long walk. Things have been a little tense around here since the quote- unquote "accident."

speaker: Niles
text: It _was_ an accident. [_goes to refill their sherries_] _As they talk, a close-up of the balcony shows disaster irrevocably unfolding:  The telescope is angled towards the sun, and the eyepiece focuses the light like a magnifying glass out to the balcony, onto the seat of the Armchair, which is already beginning to smoke._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe.  But don't you think the man should work on some of his unresolved anger toward me?

speaker: Niles
text: If you're asking me to choose sides, I'm not going to do it.

speaker: Frasier
text: The man just brings such... _hostility_ into the room! [_sighs; Niles brings his sherry_] Thank you.  You know, I've been thinking, of, uh... sending him someplace.

speaker: Niles
text: Like to a resort?

speaker: Frasier
text: Like to live with you.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes, the last resort.  Making Dad move in with me does not solve your problem, it simply avoids it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't you start preaching to me about avoidance.  You've been avoiding living with him for eight years.

speaker: Niles
text: I refuse to discuss this.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I refuse your refusal!

speaker: Niles
text: I- [_stops and sniffs the air_] Is something burning?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sniffs_] Smells like it.

speaker: Niles
text: Are you cooking?

speaker: Frasier
text: And what is that supposed to mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear God!  _The chair!!_ Both: Oh my God!

speaker: Frasier
text: Here, Niles, Niles, hand me this drop cloth here, I'm going to smother it with it!

speaker: Niles
text: Right! [_does_] Be careful, be careful, be careful!  Quickly, quickly, quickly, just-just-just...

speaker: Frasier
text: All right... _He reaches out to drape the cloth, and accidentally pushes the Chair off the balcony._

speaker: Frasier
text: OH MY GOD!!!

speaker: Niles
text: [_yelling down_] OH, LOOK OUT!!! _CUT TO: Down on the street, Martin and Daphne are walking Eddie.  Above them, Frasier and Niles' yelling can be faintly heard, but they don't notice._

speaker: Daphne
text: ...Dr. Crane's moods never last very long.  I'm sure we've seen the worst of it. _CRASH!  The still-smoking Armchair hits the sidewalk less than two feet in front of them and disintegrates.  Daphne clutches Martin's arm, while Eddie cowers between their legs.  They gape up at the 19th floor.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Six - Hallway Frasier is frantically calling the elevator.  Niles tries to calm him._

speaker: Frasier
text: What do we do?!  What do we say?!

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right, calm down.  The important thing is it didn't hit anyone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, at least we have that!  But how do we explain this?!

speaker: Niles
text: We-we just tell them what happened as clearly and rationally as possible.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right!  Right!  Rational!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, did you feel that earthquake?!

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell happened?!

speaker: Niles
text: Where's Daphne?

speaker: Martin
text: She's down cleaning up the mess!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I can explain!

speaker: Martin
text: You threw my chair off the balcony?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so sorry!  Just hear me out...

speaker: Martin
text: Are you crazy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I didn't mean to!

speaker: Martin
text: Forget what it means to me, you could have killed someone!

speaker: Frasier
text: It was an accident!

speaker: Martin
text: You said there are no accidents!

speaker: Frasier
text: But clearly I was wrong!  I mean, why on earth would I do such a thing?

speaker: Martin
text: [_seething_] Because you've always been gunning for that chair! I accidentally stain your carpet, and you set fire to the one thing in this apartment I care about and HEAVE it out into the street!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I am so sorry, I didn't mean to!  Please, forgive me! I'll buy you another chair-

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, don't do me any favors! [_stalks to his room_]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, please, Dad, look, I know you're angry right now, and that's normal.  I'll tell you what, the healthiest thing you can do right now-

speaker: Martin
text: Want to know the healthiest thing _you_ can do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Shut my yap.

speaker: Martin
text: BINGO! _He exits.  FADE TO:_ **KNEES OFF THE KEYS PLEASE** _Scene Seven - Apartment Niles stands over Daphne, who is trying to play a simple scale._

speaker: Niles
text: [_as she slowly plays each note_] Yes... yes... yes... [_she hits two keys together_] No.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_gets up in frustration_] I don't like this exercise, it's too hard!

speaker: Niles
text: [_takes her place_] No, no, no, no, you're doing fine, you just have to loosen up.  Look, I'll show you.  See? [_plays a fluid ripple of notes with one hand_] It's just a little finger exercise.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_fondles his ears_] I know another little finger exercise.

speaker: Niles
text: [_chuckles, then_] Daphne, you're not paying attention.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I am. [_sits next to him_] Why don't we just cancel the lesson and spend the day together?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  What kind of teacher would I be if I did that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that's right.  You're the teacher... [_strikes a prim and penitent pose_] And I'm the naughty student who wouldn't do her homework. _Niles looks at her... and grabs her, bending her over the bench, half-raising his knee and plunking it down loudly on the keys...  The doorbell rings._

speaker: Niles
text: [_stops_] Oh.  That'll be Roz. [_realizing his hard-on_] Could you get that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Niles! _As Niles stands up to face her, he holds the sheet music low, over his crotch._

speaker: Niles
text: How'd it go this week?

speaker: Roz
text: OK, I guess. [_hangs her coat up_] But those exercises aren't easy.

speaker: Daphne
text: See?

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right, look, if I'm going too fast, we'll make some adjustments.  Just-just do the best you can. _Roz shakes herself loose, sits at the piano, takes a deep breath, and plays a simple one-handed scale - slowly, but without a single mistake._

speaker: Niles
text: [_ecstatic, slaps her shoulder with the book_] That's great! Do it again. _Roz repeats the scale, and Niles plays a different one beside her, producing a slow a slow but sure-footed duet of Mozart's "Concerto No. 21."  Roz is excited, Daphne looks hurt._

speaker: Niles
text: You see, Daphne, that's a song.

speaker: Daphne
text: You said we weren't going to be playing songs.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Roz_] Wait, wait, go down one.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, good!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God, this is so cool!

speaker: Daphne
text: I want to play a song.

speaker: Niles
text: Well... and you will, Daphne, as soon as you master your exercises.  You know, why don't you try playing along on your practice pad? _Daphne goes to the coffee table.  Niles and Roz start the piece again while Daphne tries to follow along._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_makes another mistake_] Oh, shoot. _She sinks her head down onto the table.  FADE TO:  Scene Eight - Cafe Nervosa Frasier and Niles are sat at a table.  Martin comes in with Eddie, at which Frasier stiffens up._

speaker: Martin
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.  Um, taking Eddie for a walk?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I was afraid if I left him home, Frasier would set him on fire and throw him off the balcony. [_goes to the counter_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You see what I'm putting up with?

speaker: Niles
text: Are you going to let this go on forever?

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?  He's the one who keeps insisting I was lashing out deliberately - which I was not, although God knows it would have been justified.

speaker: Niles
text: What, because of the oil?

speaker: Frasier
text: This is a lot deeper and a lot darker than oil, and you know it.  The man will not get off my back.

speaker: Niles
text: It seems to me you've been giving as good as you've been getting.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please.  Ever since our so-called anniversary, he keeps insisting on-

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, whoa, whoa.  What does your anniversary have to do with this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess it just set me off.  It was as though everyone was saying that the only significant relationship I'll ever have again is with my father.

speaker: Niles
text: So you're not mad at Dad.  You're just mad that he isn't a woman.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I got my coffee, nothing fancy.  But if you don't like it, you're welcome to set it on fire and throw it off the balcony.  Bye, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: No, wait, Dad.  Frasier just said something very interesting to me...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles-

speaker: Niles
text: -that I think you should hear.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles-

speaker: Niles
text: No, please, let me help you through this. [_sits Martin next to Frasier_] Don't forget, I've done my share of couples' counseling.

speaker: Frasier
text: We are not a couple!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, I only meant that I'm an experienced mediator. Now, Frasier, tell Dad what you were just telling me.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_long pause_] All right.  I think... that anniversary talk stirred up some issues for me.  That our relationship is the only one I'll ever have.  That for all intents and purposes... you are my significant other.

speaker: Martin
text: And that's my fault?

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't say it was your fault, Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: You know, you think it's a picnic living with you?  It's not exactly my dream either, you know...

speaker: Niles
text: OK, no, wait, wait, honesty, this is good.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm just saying, that I-I've had a bit of a breakthrough.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, dandy!  You've had a breakthrough and I've lost my chair! Maybe I can sit on your breakthrough!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll tell you what you can sit on...!

speaker: Niles
text: [_as they lean towards each other, glaring_] OK, OK, OK, wait, wait, wait.  Let's just keep this constructive.  Now, if you're going to make any progress, you're both going to have to compromise.  Now which one of you is willing to take the first step?

speaker: Frasier
text: Allow me.

speaker: Martin
text: Do this for a living, do you? [_leaves_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_chokes out the words_] I do it because I enjoy working with people! _FADE TO:  Scene Nine -- Apartment Daphne and Niles are at the piano again. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, I've been thinking: maybe you and Roz should continue without me.

speaker: Niles
text: Why would we do that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Because she's good!

speaker: Niles
text: Just a second-

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, no, don't worry about me.  I'll find something easier to play - like a stick.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I'm not going to let you quit.  You're just a slow starter.  It may require a little more time, but you'll improve.

speaker: Daphne
text: You really think so?

speaker: Niles
text: You have to trust me. [_kisses her_] I don't care how long it takes, I'm going to make a pianist out of you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you. [_hunches over the keyboard again_] You know, you're much nicer than my old piano teacher. [_starts playing slow, halting notes_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_taken aback_] You took lessons in this before?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yeah.  Eight years of them.  Mr. Cruikshank.  You know, he once played at the Royal Albert Hall.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  Why did you stop taking the lessons, honey?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, it turns out Mr. Cruikshank was an unstable man.  Took his own life.  Do you know, I was the last person to see him alive. _As she continues playing, Niles looks borderline terrified.  Frasier comes in._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad!  Frasier's here! _Frasier notices a large something sitting where Martin's Chair was, wrapped in blue cloth and tied with a pink bow.  Martin comes out, anticipatory._

speaker: Frasier
text: What's this?

speaker: Martin
text: It's something I got to tell you how sorry I am for being such a sorehead.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad... I'm overwhelmed.

speaker: Martin
text: Tied the bow myself.  Just pull on it, it'll come right off. _Frasier pulls the cloth away, revealing a simple-but-tasteful black leather recliner._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh... oh, how unexpected.

speaker: Martin
text: You don't like it.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I-I do.  It's just that-

speaker: Martin
text: I got some guy named Eduardo to help me, I figured I couldn't miss.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's divine.

speaker: Martin
text: That's what Eduardo said.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's just... one problem.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, now, if you don't like it...

speaker: Frasier
text: I know - I can set it on fire and throw it over the balcony.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I just meant you could take it back.  I want you to be happy.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pointedly_] Frasier, I think this is a wonderful gesture on Dad's part.

speaker: Frasier
text: I do, too, Niles, I do.  I'm-I'm very touched, Dad.  Thank you, thank you so much. [_hugs Martin_] Uh, it's just that... I had something else in mind.  Uh-

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I give up.  Try to do a nice thing...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, what is the matter with you?! _Frasier opens the door to two moving men, carrying a familiar-shaped object wrapped in a white dropcloth._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, good, gentlemen, come right in, please.  Uh, just set it right over here. [_moves the new chair out of the way, they set it down_]

speaker: Martin
text: You bought a chair?  Thanks for telling me!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, just give me a chance here, I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.

speaker: Man
text: I need somebody to sign for this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.  Uh, in just a moment, please.  Could you wait for me at the door? [_they do_] Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Everyone, I would like to introduce you to the newest member of our furniture family! _He whips off the dropcloth.  Everyone gasps: it is a perfect replica of Martin's Armchair (minus the duct tape).  As they admire it, Frasier, obviously proud of himself, signs for it and sends the moving men on their way._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!... Where did you find this?

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't find that, Dad - it doesn't exist anymore.  Which is why I contacted a master builder, showed him some photographs, and had him duplicate it.  As for the material, I tracked down the original manufacturer, and once I got them to admit they made it, I had them reweave it!  [_N.B. This is not too far from the truth.  The original chair was in fact destroyed, and the technical crew had to build a replacement. They had a great deal of trouble trying to find the original material, until one of them saw an exact match to it adorning a set left over from the original "Star Trek" series, which of course was also filmed at Paramount Studios.  This puts a strange spin on Roz's line in Season One's[[1.19]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_19/give_him_the_chair.html "Give Him The Chair!"), "Give Him The Chair!" when she says that someone saw Martin's chair flying over his house, but "thought it was just a spaceship from a tacky planet."_]

speaker: Daphne
text: It must have cost a fortune!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes - ironically, this is now the most expensive piece of furniture in the entire apartment!

speaker: Niles
text: It's beautiful!

speaker: Martin
text: [_as he sits down_] Thank you, son!

speaker: Niles
text: Well done, Frasier.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it feels just the same - I don't want to get up!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's a shame, because I was planning on taking us both out to dinner this evening, Dad - anywhere you'd like!

speaker: Martin
text: [_gets up_] Even the steakhouse?

speaker: Frasier
text: Even the steakhouse! [_gets their coats_] Niles, Daphne, you're welcome to join us.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, sorry, but we're in the middle of my piano...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, we'd love to.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'll bet we can get free pie if we just tell them it's our anniversary! _They all laugh as they go out the door.  END OF ACT TWO_
